title: Transfer Life, Disney, and Prayer
description: In today's episode, I interview AJ Leong (3rd year), a Disney connoisseur and future prayer coordinator of AACF at UCI. Our conversation runs the gamut once again, so be sure to tune in 'til the end!
audioUrl: /audio/Transfer Life, Disney, and Prayer with AJ Leong.mp3

title: The Lore
description: In today's episode, I talk to special guests Timmy Wada and Janice Ngai (new grads) about the backstory behind their relationship and what it's looked like for them to invite Christ into it.
audioUrl: /audio/The Lore with Timmy Wada and Janice Ngai.mp3

title: Generational Faith, Heaven, and Theology
description: In today's episode, I chat with Daniel Park (2nd Year) about his faith foundations that began in his infancy, and dive in head-first to some intriguing topics relating to heaven and the nature of faith. Buckle in -- this one will get your gears turning!
audioUrl: /audio/Generational Faith, Heaven, and Theology with Daniel Park.mp3

title: From Atheist to Christian
description: In today's episode, I chat with my high school buddy, Josh Nguyen (3rd year), about his incredible faith journey growing up, throughout high school, and during our first two years of college. This one's a rollercoaster -- buckle in!
audioUrl: /audio/From Atheist to Christian with Josh Nguyen.mp3

title: Kansas, Small Groups, and Family
description: In today's episode, I interview my second cousin, Madi (2nd Year) about her experiences growing up in the Midwest and what it was like transitioning to a new state, college, and fellowship! We also cover the exciting future of AACF small groups for the year and chat about her experiences in the ministry. Welcome to Season 2 of Double-A Discourse!
audioUrl: /audio/Kansas, Small Groups, and Family with Madi Hsu.mp3

title: PK Life, Gospel Sharing, and Choosing Wisely
description: In today's episode, I chat with our men's ministry coordinator Josiah (2nd year) about his experience growing up as a pastor's kid and how it's shaped his relationship with Christ. p.s. if you listen closely, you might catch a special announcement in this episode!
audioUrl: /audio/PK Life, Gospel Sharing, and Choosing Wisely with Josiah Kira.mp3

title: Wisdom Wednesday E1 | What is True Wisdom?
description: Welcome to the first episode of our new segment, Wisdom Wednesday! Today, we're diving into the question of what true wisdom is, and how to seek it in our own lives. If you have questions you'd like to have discussed on a future episode, feel free to let me know :).

title: DMV, Durians, and Discord
description: In today's episode, I interview the Discord-famous Lukas Hu (3rd Year) as we dive into his highly mobile upbringing, the lore behind our paths crossing via my roommates, and the happenings of the Double-A Discord!
audioUrl: /audio/DMV, Durians, and Discord with Lukas Hu.mp3

title: Wisdom Wednesday E2 | Jesus' Scariest Words (And Why They Don't Need To Be!)
description: In today's segment of Wisdom Wednesday, we study what many believe to be Jesus' scariest words. After a deeper dive, we discover why they are actually a loving invitation to develop a closer relationship with Him. Happy first episode of the year!
audioUrl: /audio/Wisdom Wednesday E2 | Jesus' Scariest Words (And Why They Don't Need To Be!).mp3

title: Siblings, Scripture, and Soundtracks
description: In today's episode, I chat with Nicole Yamaguchi (3rd year) about her upbringing in the church, the lore behind her band kid energy, and debut our first audience Q&A! Happy Spring Break!
audioUrl: /audio/Siblings, Scripture, and Soundtracks with Nicole Yamaguchi.mp3

title: Snapshots, Serving, and Starting New
description: In today's episode, I chat with my prayer partner Gabe Zhang (2nd year), where he shares his about his views on serving the church and his journey to joining AACF in his second year at UCI. Stay tuned for a special reversal section, where the host becomes the interviewee!
audioUrl: /audio/Snapshots, Serving, and Starting New with Gabe Zhang.mp3

title: Counseling, Calling, and Comedy
description: Today, I chat with Ryan Takiguchi (5th year), as we dive into his unique schooling journey and explore some of the most fascinating (and funny!) questions that studying theology invites us into.
audioUrl: /audio/Counseling, Calling, and Comedy with Ryan Takiguchi.mp3
